oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Music History program - various voice overs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Various voice overs by an unidentified male narrator. Subject matter pertains to the history of country music, and recording is likely linked to a country music history radio program, exhibit, or documentary. Tape related to RT-7-02165.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) [Unidentified] talks about country music being close to popular media outlets -- (00:21) [Unidentified] talks about country music moving to radio -- (00:46) [Unidentified] talks about the earliest country music radio programs, including WLS Barndance, WSM Grand Ole Opry, KWKH Louisiana Hayride, WWVA Jamboree, Springfield's Ozark Jubilee, WRVA Old Dominion Barndance, and the Renfro Valley Barndance -- (01:32) [Unidentified] talks about members of the Grand Ole Opry -- (01:45) [Unidentified] talks about country music going to television -- (02:15) [Unidentified] talks about WSM radio -- (02:32) [Unidentified] talks about the Grand Ole Opry house, and country music's relationship with the broadcast industry -- (03:09) [Unidentified] talks about country music being here to stay
